alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 31 at 8:24PM CDT until November 01 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Tuesday was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 11.0 feet Tuesday, November 07. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.7 feet on 05/10/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1100 AM CDT.
